Wall Street economists had forecast a higher April trade deficit of $10.0 billion.
Both imports and exports were at record levels in April.

The volume of total crude and petroleum product imports rose in April to 309.9 million barrels from 302.8 million in March. But the total value fell to $5.49 billion in April from $5.81 billionpp The price of imported crude oil dropped to an average $17.17 a barrel in April from $18.72 a barrel in March. The value of April crude oil imports fell to $4.29 billion from $4.38 billion.
The department said the $970 million deficit with Canada, the country with which the United States has the largest volume of trade, was the lowest since a $900 million shortfall in March 1995.
But the April deficit with Japan of $4.8 billion was the highest in six months since a $4.9 billion shortfall in October last year.

The balance-of-payments basis for recording U.S. trade via receipts from and payments to other countries includes adjustments for military shipments, nonmonetary gold, and inland freight trade with Canada and Mexico.
Census basis data uses information collected by the U.S. Customs Service on goods shipped across U.S. borders.
